meanings.definition: A remote or isolated rural area.
meanings.sent1: My grandparents live in the boondocks, surrounded by fields and forests.
meanings.sent2: The cabin was hidden deep in the boondocks, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
meanings.sent3: When we got lost in the boondocks, we had to rely on a map and the stars to find our way back.
meanings.sent4: The boondocks felt like a different world, where time moved slower and nature ruled.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the boondocks painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.

meanings.sent1: Explorers ventured into the boondocks, hoping to discover new species of plants and animals.
meanings.sent2: The hikers set up camp in the boondocks, surrounded by untouched wilderness.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined the boondocks to be filled with hidden treasures and secret caves.
meanings.sent4: The boondocks whispered tales of ancient mysteries waiting to be unraveled.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight cast an eerie glow over the boondocks, creating a sense of adventure and mystery.
